lexUnit.name: flash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shine or cause to shine in a bright but brief, sudden, or intermittent way.

sentence.text: His eyes flashed and he presented his elegant moustaches .
He could not sit still , and hurried up and down his small cell , gasping with terror , his eyes flashing with hate and anger .
Ixora stared up , her body in darkness , her emerald eyes flashing wildly in a single sidelong strip of daylight .
The knife flashed in the spotlight , glinting viciously before the razor-sharp blade was drawn across his throat .
Their gutting knives flashing in time to the music .
Then thunder roared and lightning flashed
Lightning flashed in the sky , and there was a loud crash of thunder .
A glint of panic flashed in the boy 's eyes because he did not speak English very well .
Anger flashed in his eyes .
A look of terror flashed across Kirov 's face , the terror of having committed an indiscretion .
He grinned , white teeth flashing in his tanned face .
The sensors in the Gunnery Sergeant 's shield flashed and his head was encased in a yellow glow .
Something flashed pale-mauve in the side of her teeth .
The car appeared , flashing green and white , and raced down towards Bigwig .
The woman turned a dial on the TV set and the screen flashed blue .
Teeth flashing very white in his mahogany , sweat-beaded face , he ran lightly over to talk to the band and Tara came barefoot over to their table .
His teeth flashed briefly and brilliantly .
He knelt beside her and she saw concern flash across his features .
25 The warning lights on two shipping buoys flash at fixed intervals of time .
` Now , " he said , producing his sword , which flashed in the evening sunlight , ` let me show you .
It flashed in the moonlight .
The birds had a habit of dipping their beaks in the water and then shaking their heads so that the ivory-coloured beaks flashed in the sun .
Damian chose a huge square-cut emerald set in platinum that flashed like green fire against her finger .

And as he spoke , El-ahrairah 's tail grew shining white and flashed like a star : and his back legs grew long and powerful and he thumped the hillside until the very beetles fell off the grass-stems .
He saw Ratagan 's axe flash like a star and bury itself in a hairy snout , splintering black blood .
Sensing her disbelief grow and surround him , he flashed with petulant anger .
He had been wearing his turned-down wellington boots and long rubber apron , and the gold in his teeth had flashed with reflected sunlight .
` We will want to know if the warning lights had only been flashing for 10 seconds and not 30 . "
The signals were flashing furiously ; was this the breakthrough she was after ?
His teeth flashed whitely as he glanced up from his task .
